title: IB Physics - Atomic, Nuclear & Particle Physics
subject: physics
description: Quiz covering atomic structure, radioactive decay, nuclear reactions, and particle physics for IB Physics
author: OpenNotes

questions.question: In alpha decay, the nucleus emits:
questions.explanation: Alpha decay: nucleus emits $^4_2\text{He}$ (2 protons + 2 neutrons). Atomic number decreases by 2, mass number by 4.

questions.question: The half-life of a radioactive isotope is $8$ days. What fraction of the original sample remains after $24$ days?

Calculate the energy released (in MeV) when 1 u of mass is converted to energy. Use $1 \text{ u} = 1.661 \times 10^{-27}$ kg and $c = 3 \times 10^8$ m s$^{-1}$. ($1 \text{ MeV} = 1.6 \times 10^{-13}$ J). Round to nearest whole number.
In beta-minus ($\beta^-$) decay:
options: A neutron converts to a proton, emitting an electron and antineutrino
A proton converts to a neutron, emitting a positron and neutrino
A neutron is simply ejected from the nucleus
An electron is captured by the nucleus
questions.explanation: $\beta^-$ decay: $n \rightarrow p + e^- + \bar{\nu}_e$. A neutron converts to a proton, emitting an electron and an electron antineutrino.

questions.question: The binding energy per nucleon is highest for:
questions.explanation: Iron-56 has the highest binding energy per nucleon (~8.8 MeV). This is why fusion releases energy for elements lighter than Fe, and fission for heavier elements.

questions.question: Which fundamental force is responsible for holding quarks together inside a proton?
questions.explanation: The strong nuclear force (mediated by gluons) binds quarks together inside hadrons (protons and neutrons).

questions.question: A proton is composed of which combination of quarks?
In nuclear fission of $^{235}U$:
options: A heavy nucleus splits into smaller nuclei, releasing energy and neutrons
Two light nuclei combine to form a heavier nucleus
A nucleus emits an alpha particle
questions.explanation: Fission: $^{235}U + n \rightarrow$ fission products + neutrons + energy. The mass defect is converted to kinetic energy.

questions.question: The activity of a radioactive sample is measured as $800$ Bq. After two half-lives, the activity will be:
questions.explanation: After 1 half-life: $400$ Bq. After 2 half-lives: $200$ Bq. Activity halves each half-life period.

questions.question: Which of the following particles is a lepton?
questions.explanation: Leptons: electron, muon, tau, and their neutrinos. Proton and neutron are baryons (hadrons). Pion is a meson (hadron).

questions.question: In the Bohr model, the energy of the $n$-th level of hydrogen is $E_n = \frac{-13.6}{n^2}$ eV. The energy of the photon emitted in a transition from $n=3$ to $n=2$ is:
In nuclear fusion: $^2_1H + ^3_1H \rightarrow ^4_2He + ^1_0n$. The total mass of reactants is $5.03014$ u and of products is $5.01101$ u. Calculate the mass defect in atomic mass units (u).
